TopicTitle: Eurofighter Typhoon replica with weapons full optional

Articles.Content:
Hi, i think this plane deserves a personal thread, so i post here the craft.

This is my definitive version of this beautifull fighter (my favourite one).

What is different than my previous versions? new rudder,new ladder for a best look and first of all she comes "war ready": missiles, rockets, bombs and a external fuel tank; all of this coloured with kerbpaint.

Performs like the original: about mach 2 max speed.

Owner manual:

press space to stage in this order:

-activate engine

-fire PASR (Pro Aiming Small Rocket)

-fire second PASR

-fire PAMR (Casual Aiming Medium Rocket)

-fire second PAMR

-fire RCM (Remote Control Missile), when shot press ' or ÃƒÂ¬ to switch from plane to missile view and control it, be carefull! don't go too far away from plane

-fire second RCM

-fire bomb

-fire bomb

-fire bomb

-fire bomb

-decouple external fuel tank

Keys

-press 1 to toggle ladder

-press 4,6 to decouple bombs 2x

-press 0 to decouple external fuel tank

When fired the first RCM the plane become a little unstable due control surfaces on the RCM left, when all 2 RCMs are fired all is ok.

NEW VERSION!

Different angle of wings, modified air intakes, more overall lenght for a best thin look, better weapon management and better rockets.

Edited March 23, 2014 by eorin

Good Job! It is nice looking replica ;d

Keep it up!

I use Junior Docking clamps on my missiles and bombs so that I wont need to have cubit struts and their decouples. (aerodynamically its bad.) Just a little tip if you would like to try out. You can do whatever you like.

Great craft btw, haven't seen anyone recreate this bird.
That looks great, I hope you try some American jets too. ;P

Great craft btw, haven't seen anyone recreate this bird.
